name: Chinese Folk Music
description: Traditional folk of the Chinese people.

children.name: Chaozhou xianshi
children.description: Traditional and instrumental ensemble music originating from Chaozhou; played mainly on stringed instruments.

children.name: Han Folk Music
children.description: Chinese folk form often played at weddings and funerals, using the Suona (a form of oboe) and Chuigushou (a specific type of percussive ensemble), together with heterophony.

children.name: Haozi
children.description: Chinese Work Song that originated from collective manual labor and usually follows a call-and-response structure, aiming to coordinate work.

children.name: Jiangnan sizhu
children.description: Originating from Jiangnan region and played by a varying ensemble of stringed instruments, flutes, mouth organs and small percussions.

children.description: Folk songs found in upland regions of China, typically sung while working.
